sentence: In a trio of complaints filed this week, attorneys working with the state Democratic Party said they found problems with the nominating petitions filed by former Detroit police chief James Craig, businessman Perry Johnson and conservative commentator Tudor Dixon enough to disqualify all three from the Aug. 2 primary, they argue.
title: Michigan Democrats accuse GOP candidates of using forged signatures to get on ballot

sentence: Craig's campaign faces two challenges one from a Michigan resident represented by lawyer and former Michigan Democratic Party Chair Mark Brewer and another from Michigan Strong PAC, a conservative group supporting GOP gubernatorial candidate Tudor Dixon's campaign.
author: Paul Egan
title: James Craig acknowledges possible fraud in signature gathering for his petition

sentence: Another GOP candidate, Tudor Dixon, had also contested Craig's voter signatures as fake.
author: DAVID EGGERT
title: Primary problem: Michigan GOP governor candidates short signatures

sentence: "The DeVos family have decided to stand with Tudor Dixon as being the next right governor for the state of Michigan," Dick DeVos said Monday on the Paul W. Smith show on WJR-AM in Detroit.
author: Paul Egan
title: Michigan's DeVos family throws its support behind Tudor Dixon for governor

sentence: The reports also say that Oakland County businessman and "quality guru" Perry Johnson did not file enough valid signatures, but they clear Norton Shores businesswoman Tudor Dixon, whose petitions were also the subject of a complaint.
author: Paul Egan
title: State elections report: James Craig and Perry Johnson filed too few signatures for ballot

sentence: Craigs signatures had been challenged by Democrats and a superPAC supporting right-wing media personality Tudor Dixon.
title: GOP candidates deemed ineligible as massive signature fraud scandal upends Michigan gubernatorial race

sentence: Currently, there are five Republican candidates for governor on the August ballot: businessman Kevin Rinke, right-wing media personality Tudor Dixon, chiropractor Garrett Soldano, far-right activist Ryan Kelley and the Rev.
author: Jon King
title: Michigan 'quality guru' Perry Johnson remains off August primary ballot after unanimous court ruling
